extends java.lang.Object

        Returns the name of the Sprite.

        Returns the Point the Sprite is on.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the buffered image for the Sprite.
        Returns:
        Buffered image.

      • step

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage step​(Direction d)
        Returns the image for the Sprite taking a step in the specified direction by looping through the array of Sprite images to find the one corresponding with the given direction.
        Parameters:
        d - The direction the Sprite is facing.
        Returns:
        Buffered image of the Sprite.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(Direction d)
        Sets the direction for the Sprite.
        Parameters:
        d - The enumeration direction for the Sprite.

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Returns the Sprite direction.
        Returns:
        Direction enumeration.

      • move

        public void move()
        Method for controlling how the Sprite moves. Uses the direction of the Sprite to change the point that the Sprite is standing on, giving the illusion of movement.

      • getPointAsString

        public java.lang.String getPointAsString()
        Returns a String representation of the Sprite Point. This makes it easier to compare Sprite positions to check for collisions.
        Returns:
        Players point as a String.
